com.tooltwist.fastXml
Class FastXml

java.lang.Object
  com.tooltwist.fastXml.FastXml
All Implemented Interfaces:
XSelector, Iterable<XSelector>
public class FastXml
extends Object
implements XSelector, Iterable<XSelector>

This class is used to provide high speed XML access. In particular, it avoids creating large numbers of XML objects, like the DOM parser. This parser does not provide comprehensive XPATH or DOM operations.

Author:
philipcallender
See Also:
com.dinaa.XData

findNodes

protected int findNodes(int childNodeNum,
                        int requiredIndent,
                        FastXml.PathSegments segments,
                        int segmentIndex,
                        int totalMatches,
                        FastXmlNodes list,
                        int requiredOccurrence)
The method recursively searches for nodes that match the specified selection path / occurrence. Each time this method is called, it checks the nodes under a parent against a specific segment. The childNodeNum specifies the first of the child nodes (which has an indent of requiredIndent). The code loops around for each of the child nodes, checking the following: [1] Does the name match the current segment? (exact match or *) [2] Does the index match the required index for this segment? (exact match or -1) [3] If further segments need to be matched, check the children of the node next segment of the path again. [4] If there are no further path segments to be checked, the node is a match. [5] If requiredOccurance is not specified, and the node to the list and continue checking. [6] If the requiredOccurrance is specified, and totalMatches equals requiredOccurrence, we have a node we need, so add it to the list and return -1. Always return the total number of matches so far so we can keep count, except when the required occurrence has been found (if it was specified), in which case return -1.

Parameters:
childNodeNum - The first node at the new level. We'll skip from node to node at this level using node.next.
requiredIndent - The indent in FastJson in the depth in the hierarchy. It doesn't match up exactly with xpaths because some node types (objects) jump down two levels.
segments - The segments making up the path.
segmentIndex - The index into segments that we are currently checking. This method is recursive. In the first invocation, level should be zero.
totalMatches - The total number of matches of the full path that we've found so far. This is passed around through the various recurring, so we can work out when a specific 'occurrence' has been reached.
list - The list to place the matching nodes into.
requiredOccurrence - If non-negative, only place the occurrence'th node into list.
Returns:
Total number of matches so far.

splitSelectionPathIntoSegments

protected FastXml.PathSegments splitSelectionPathIntoSegments(String xpath)
Split a selection path into segments. For example "/abc/def[123]/ghi" becomes two arrays: name = [ "abc", "def", "ghi" index = [ -1, 123, -1 ]

This object avoids using a list of {name,index} because we're shooting for speed (trying to minimize collection traversal) and trying to reduce object creation.

Parameters:
xpath - A selection path (eg. "/abc/def[123]")
Returns:
A PathSegments object, containing the names and indexes, or null if the path is invalid.

first

public void first()
This data type does not provide a list of records, so the next() method only returns true once.

To iterate over elements within this object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
This data type does not provide a list of records, so this method only returns true until next() is called.

To iterate over elements within this object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

Specified by:
hasNext in interface XSelector
Returns:
True if there is another element in the selection.

next

public boolean next()
This selector does not provide a list of records, so this method only returns true one time. Actually it serves no purpose other than to allow iterators to access the data that can be accessed directly. For example, 
 FastXml data = ...;
 String value = data.string("./name");
will return exactly the same as: 
 FastXml data = ...;
 while (data.next()) {
   String value = data.string("./name");
 }

To iterate over a list of elements within this data object, use select(String) or one of the foreach(String) methods.

Specified by:
next in interface XSelector

Return the name of the field currently selected. For example, if you used select("/* /customer") to get this XDSelector object, then the field name will be "customer".

select

public XSelector select(String xpath)
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Select a list. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 XDSelector list = data.select("/* /product");
 while (list.next()) {
        String description = list.string("description");
 }

foreach

public void foreach(String xpath,
                    XDCallback callback)
             throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Iterate through matching items using a callback object to handle each item. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 Object myData = ...;
 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

Specified by:
foreach in interface XSelector
Throws:
XDException

foreach

public void foreach(String xpath,
                    Object userData,
                    XDCallback callback)
             throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Iterate through matching items using a callback object to handle each item. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 MyData myData = ...;
 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
     MyData myData = (MyData) data;
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

Specified by:

foreach

public Iterable<XSelector> foreach(String xpath)
                            throws XDException
Description copied from interface: XSelector
Iterate through items using Iterable notation. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 for (IXData item : data.foreach("/* /product")) {
        String description = item.string("description");
 }
